block.p: What makes Americans part with their dollars, and why? The Times Magazine examines the spending habits of today's society, in a variety of ''shopping centers'' -- from Fifth Avenue to the inside of a jail, from a pawnshop to a research lab. The biggest spenders include a generation of rich anti materialists, and splurgers who know that money may not buy happiness but take their chances anyway. A special issue.
